tournament.name: Manila Duel Commander September 2013 (Quezon City, Philippines)

decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to utilize Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the game by using countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck includes a variety of efficient creatures like Venser, Shaper Savant and Vendilion Clique, along with powerful spells such as Supreme Verdict and Force of Will to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to enhance Geist's attacking abilities. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors and includes utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Dust Bowl. Overall, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's threats while developing its own board presence to secure victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Grand Arbiter Augustin IV's ability to tax opponents' spells and abilities, slowing down their game plan while ramping up your own resources. With a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents over the course of the game. By efficiently managing resources and making strategic decisions, the deck seeks to establish a dominant position and grind out victories through incremental advantages. The deck includes a variety of control elements, such as permission spells, board wipes, and card filtering, allowing you to adapt to different types of threats and stay ahead in the game.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game using Grand Arbiter Augustin IV as the commander. The deck includes a variety of lands to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain card advantage. The spells in the deck focus on countering threats, removing opposing creatures, and drawing cards. The goal is to control the game tempo, protect the commander, and establish a dominant position on the battlefield. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth, Knight-Errant, as well as equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine to further enhance control and win conditions. The deck is designed to outmaneuver and outlast opponents through a combination of control elements and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing Zur the Enchanter's ability to search for powerful enchantments that can control the game. It includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, hand disruption, and board wipes to keep opponents in check. By tutoring for specific enchantments like Detention Sphere, Nevermore, and Steel of the Godhead, the deck can lock down threats and buff Zur for lethal commander damage. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil provides additional control elements. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's three-color requirements and includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Wasteland to disrupt opponents' strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the aggro strategy with Ezuri, Renegade Leader as the commander. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of elf creatures and utilize Ezuri's ability to pump them up for lethal attacks. The deck includes various elves that provide mana acceleration, card draw, and removal options to support the aggressive playstyle. Cards like Craterhoof Behemoth and Triumph of the Hordes can provide a game-ending boost to the elf army. The deck also includes utility lands like Gaea's Cradle and Tectonic Edge to further support the aggressive game plan. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to quickly build a strong elf army and use Ezuri's abilities to close out the game efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the game through a combination of powerful spells, card advantage, and efficient creature removal. The strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, board wipes, and targeted removal while maintaining a strong board presence with evasive threats like Geist of Saint Traft and other creature options such as Vendilion Clique and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck also includes a toolbox of equipment and enchantments to provide additional utility and power to the creatures on the battlefield. By efficiently managing resources and controlling the tempo of the game, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure a victory through attrition and strategic plays.

decks.player: Juan Carlos Gutierrez  Team Oh No!
decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the various dragons and powerful creatures in the deck to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent. The deck includes a wide range of versatile spells and creatures that can be searched for and played at the right moment to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect your own creatures. The commander, Scion of the Ur-Dragon, serves as a versatile tool for finding and playing the dragons in the deck, while the accompanying support cards help to ramp up mana, disrupt the opponent's plays, and provide additional utility. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging the powerful creatures in the deck, the goal is to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and secure victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Zur the Enchanter to search for powerful enchantments and control the game by disrupting your opponent's strategies. It has a wide range of counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats, along with a variety of hand disruption spells to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Dark Confidant and Phyrexian Arena to stay ahead in the game. The mana base is designed to provide a good balance of colored mana sources to cast your spells efficiently. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game, disrupt your opponent, and utilize Zur's ability to search for key enchantments to dominate the battlefield and emerge victorious.
